title.label: Cute game but Online is worthless

content.label: We bought this game to play together but can’t play it long enough to make a good read if its good. We only managed to get one game actually created and it locked up before I could build my ship. Every other time the games just crashes when you try to start the online game. So try at at your own risk if you want to play online.

title.label: Really fun and helpful as board game companion

content.label: The game is super fun just like the board game. The rules of the board game can be a bit overwhelming, but spending an extra five bucks for this app really helps one understand the nuance of the game. Overall, it’s really enjoyable and well designed game.

title.label: Great Game, but missing a number of features

content.label:
It’s a great adaptation of the board game on the surface, but lack of some features can make it very frustrating. 
1) Formatting.  The game is not formatted well for newer iPhones with some elements hard to click on and read.  It definitely needs some UI tuning. 
2) Push Notifications.  PLEASE ADD PUSH NOTIFICATIONS.  Turn based games are way harder to play if I have to remember to come back and check the game for my turn.

It would be a great game if it actually worked and the IT responded. 2 stars instead of 0 because the game is fun when it works, only 2 stars because they don’t seem to care much as its been a week and nothing has been fixed. 

If something changes, and the game works, would be happy to change to 5 stars.

title.label: If you loved the board game, buy this!!

content.label: It’s exactly like playing the board game but get rid of all that set up and clean up!
Little tricky on a small screen but I really enjoy it

title.label: No designed for iPhones with Face ID notch in screeen

content.label: It is not designed for newer phones. The tutorial instructions are no visible because hide behind notch at top of phones X and higher. I also purchased the game on iPad and it’s identical. The words and everything too small. Why charge me for a pocket edition if it is not modified to be more functional at its small size. It should be sold as same version.

Fun game. I’d give it more stars but it’s not formatted correctly for the new iPhone 11s. The whole top is my screen is blocked and I cannot read many things or see the other players I’m playing with.
NPC text dialog threads are too long, and repetitive animations bog down game play.  Once is fine, but having to go through them every time grinds gameplay to a frustrating halt.
Interface needs update.   Status bar and buttons obscured by notch in iPhone 11 Pro Max.
Unfortunately text and buttons are covered up on the top and bottom of the iPhone 11 Pro.

We currently have an online Green glow mission, started by Vlysandor, with also hackenbacker, conmanjoe, and nitro9 playing. All claim that the game itself has finished in the lobby screen (when in fact, we have just started the stage 3 flight, having already completed a stage 2 flight). But when we open the game, it appears to be nitro9’s turn, and nitro9 herself is unable to turn over any tiles. This way, her 3-day reserve countdown clock before being dropped from the game is ticking, but we can’t do anything about it. Please take a look and fix, thanks!

-keen trucker

title.label: Loved the board and love this!

content.label: This satisfies my desire to play this game when I'm on the go!

title.label: Excellent port of the board game

content.label: A faithful and well made version of the board game.  Polished, great sound effects and sound track and a fantastic campaign mode to keep you building the most ridiculous space ships.  Plenty of humor, had me chuckling many times. The designers and programmers did a great job bringing this awesome game to iOS.  I’m having a blast with it.

title.label: unnecessary slow cuts and animations hinder a decent port of the classic boardgame

content.label:
lol at the review on top tgat said you should be able to “buy a prebuilt ship.” I think you miss the point of the game. You’re supposed to build ridiculous ships. the board game is a scramble for tiles irl.

That being said, why did the   app makers think it would be fun to pad a really
 fast game with slow flavor text cut scenes and really slow redundant animations? yes there’s a FF button that sorta works...but it would be nice to have the option to play the actual game. also a drag that we cannot quit and restart where we left off without having to dreg through all the padding.

I’ve tried Agricola aka multiplayer FarmVille.. 7 Wonders..Zzz. And a few others. 

This is one of the best. Has a fully fleshed out single player campaign with dialogue and routes. 

Lots of fun.
It's a fun game but I can't make an account to play online because it says "connection to server failed". Every single time I try. Please help me. I got payed for this game so I could play online.
and wonderful work right out of the gate! Kudos and congrats!
Game play is fun enough, but multiplayer is interrupted by server disconnects and missing game notifications.

Great fun, nice mobile version of a board game. The sound effects and slight animations are a nice addition. The fast forward button is perfect to zoom through what you don’t want to take too long.

Keep in mind that the main part of this is the ship build, it’s not so much about the flight as it is the building!

title.label: Wonderful app adaptation of a quirky masterpiece

content.label:
I haven’t yet played the cardboard version but this captures the back and forth of the game’s two very different but tightly linked phases. Not a game for everyone but I love it. Campaign is well designed.

My only complaint is that the animations for each event can drag a little once you’ve been playing awhile.

This is a fun space race because it starts with you building your own ship from a pile of parts. Yes, this take a minute to do, but younger to make it! Then fly your ship in a race with other players while getting attacked along the way.

Pro
Easy to play and learn
Watch your ship slowly fall apart
Turn based race so you can take your time making decisions
Does not require internet to play

Con
Not super challenging, but lots of variety.

title.label: Opening App Tried to Bill Me

content.label: I opened the app for the first time and I got a message saying Purchase Failed. I assume the app had tried to do an in-app purchase as it opened, so that is an instant delete.

I love this electronic version of the card game.  It plays well, is balanced in difficulty and keeps my interest. 
It reminds me of Escape Velocity Nova from years back. 
Worth a look.

title.label: Very fun game with some room to improve the app

content.label: The game is a blast, but the animations could be a bit faster. Would be great to have a feature to skip a lot of that without having to continuously press the fast forward button.

title.label: Great game. Simple but fun strategy.

content.label: I enjoy the two separate parts of the game - ship building, and then adventuring with the ship you’ve built. There is sufficient variety to keep it interesting and simple enough mechanics to avoid over frustration.

So far, I've only played Campaign mode, but I really enjoy it! Building a ship at the same time as everyone else is stressful and exciting. The Challenges are a great test of how well the building stage went. And the dialogue is hilarious. It's a really great world, with perfect graphics and quirky storylines.

Loving this app. It’s not perfect: the animations are unnecessary and the campaign dialogue isn’t my thing. But it’s a lot of fun to play and keeps me coming back for more. Been interested in GT ever since I saw the board game reviewed (Shut Up and Sit Down via YouTube). Excited to try multiplayer in the app, then likely buy the board game and expansion.

Everything works well (haven't tried internet play). Being that it's a port from an actual card game, it's a little boring after a few hours of play. 

Is there no way to turn off animations between turns? Takes WAY too long for the little astronauts to fly over and get their booty. 

Lost a star for hounding me for a review.

It takes so long to make your ship— EACH ROUND— and the rounds are SHORT— that after about six times, I’m ready to call it quits... for a $5 app, i would expect a feature where you can buy a prebuilt core to your ship so you don’t spend forever prepping for each round.  Please change that. I know when I play the board game with my friends, we have to change the rules because otherwise you’d spend 4/5 of the evening rebuilding ship after ship instead of going on the adventure cards...

I love this game and love the app. With the second-to-last update I cannot play online games unless I’m on WiFi. I get an error message saying I’m not online, even though I receive push notifications (which used to not work, so thanks for fixing that).

In addition, the game crashes every time I try to peek at cards in a multiplayer game. Again, this never used to happen.
Opening tutorial or campaign causes game to crash
This app crashes to “desktop” when I try to start a campaign game on the iPhone 7+ even though my OS is up to date.
Ever since the iOS 11.0.2 update my game crashes as soon as the ship building screen loads. This happens every time.
Game crashes on launching the campaign or the tutorial. iPhone 6s. Any suggestions TIA.
This is a really well done app version of an already excellent boardgame, the app really captures the humor and style of the game perfectly and the solo campaign is hours of fun.
Great playability. Just like the board game!
The September update includes a bug that kicks you out of the app when loading a multiplayer game.
Great game

title.label: Constantly asked me to review game

content.label:
I was going to leave a very nice review, but after telling the game I'd leave one later, it asked me after every...single...thing. Constantly. So 1 star for that. 5 stars for the actual game though.

Support contacted me, gana send them a bug report on this issue. So they're addressing it, which is god enough for me. Still leaving the review up as is (with the addendum) but I've changed the rating to 5 stars, which is what the gameplay portion of the game deserves.
I love this game and am spending WAY too much time playing it.
The board game is a lot of fun and the app is just as fun! Love the campaign and the mechanics are wonderfully translated to the app. So far haven't had any problems with it either.

title.label: Great port of a board game

content.label: Really enjoying the campaign. It's a faithful port from the board game.
Get it

title.label: Love the game and the style

content.label: Most people either love or hate the cardboard version.  There appear to be very few people who are on middle ground.  I'm one who loves it, and this version is great because there is no setup or clean up.

title.label: My god. I don't care about missions

content.label: Please let me turn off the notification for them.

Great board game; great phone app.

I recommend it.
I love the board game and this is so much fun!
Highly addictive!
I enjoy the campaign mode. I can play single player and have fun doing missions not just fighting AI like other games. So you don't have to rely on multi-player in this app.
